mySound = audio3d.loadSfx('blue.wav')

Sounds can be attached to objects such that when they move, the sound source will move along with them.

audio3d.attachSoundToObject(mySound, teapot)

You can use the manager's ~direct.showbase.Audio3DManager.Audio3DManager.setSoundVelocity() and ~direct.showbase.Audio3DManager.Audio3DManager.setListenerVelocity() to set the velocity of sounds or the listener to get the doppler pitch shifting of moving objects. If you would like the ~direct.showbase.Audio3DManager to help you adjust the velocity of moving objects automatically like it does with their position, you can call ~direct.showbase.Audio3DManager.Audio3DManager.setSoundVelocityAuto() or ~direct.showbase.Audio3DManager.Audio3DManager.setListenerVelocityAuto() like this:

audio3d.setSoundVelocity(sound, velocityVector)
audio3d.setListenerVelocity(velocityVector)

base.cTrav = CollisionTraverser()
audio3d.setSoundVelocityAuto(sound)
audio3d.setListenerVelocityAuto()
